src:
Fiscal José Luis Perez Calaf será el encargado de investigar querella contra el Presidente Piñera
Además investigará a quienes resulten responsables de violaciones a los derechos humanos ocurridos desde el estado de excepción en adelante.
07 Nov 2019 by Diego Álvarez
José Luis Perez Calaf será el fiscal a cargo de indagar la querella presentada en contra del Presidente Sebastián Piñera y quieres resulten responsables de violaciones a los derechos humanos ocurridos desde el estado de excepción en adelante.
Fue el Fiscal Nacional Jorge Abbot quien designó al fiscal jefe metropolitano Occidente, como el encargado de la labor. La querella es interpuesta por 16 abogados acusa que desde el inicio del estallido social, las Fuerzas Armadas y policiales habrían cometido hasta nueve tipos de delito, según consignó La Tercera.
Los 16 abogados que interponen la querella solicitaron varias diligencias entre las que se encuentra citar a declarar al exjefe de la Defensa Nacional, Javier Iturriaga, al general director de Carabineros, Mario Rosas y también, al exministro del interior, Andrés Chadwick.
text:
Prosecutor José Luis Perez Calaf will be in charge of investigating a complaint against President Piñera
It will also investigate those responsible for human rights violations that occurred from the state of exception onwards.
07 Nov 2019 by Diego Álvarez
José Luis Perez Calaf will be the prosecutor in charge of investigating the complaint filed against President Sebastián Piñera and you want to be responsible for human rights violations that occurred from the state of exception onwards.
It was the National Prosecutor Jorge Abbot who appointed the Western Metropolitan Chief Prosecutor as the person in charge of the work. The complaint is filed by 16 lawyers accusing that since the beginning of the social outbreak, the Armed Forces and police would have committed up to nine types of crime, according to La Tercera.
The 16 lawyers who lodged the complaint requested several proceedings, including the declaration of the former National Defense Chief, Javier Iturriaga, the General Director of Police, Mario Rosas and also the former Minister of the Interior, Andrés Chadwick.
